implementation_steps.task_description: Create a minimal package.json for a React project. Include name "simple-todo-app", version, scripts: "start": "react-scripts start", "build": "react-scripts build", and dependencies: react, react-dom, and devDependencies: react-scripts. This file is the foundation for npm install and will be used before any source files are compiled.

Add a basic HTML5 skeleton with a
placeholder. Include a Simple Todo App and link to the bundled JS via the React build process. No external scripts are needed; this file will be loaded by the development server and serves as the mount point for the React tree rendered in src/index.js.

Implement the entry point: import React, ReactDOM, and the App component from './App'. Use ReactDOM.createRoot(document.getElementById('root')).render(<React.StrictMode><App /></React.StrictMode>); Export nothing. This file bootstraps the UI and must run after the HTML file is ready.

Create two utility functions:
1. `export const loadTasks = () => { const data = localStorage.getItem('tasks'); return data ? JSON.parse(data) : []; }`
2. `export const saveTasks = (tasks) => { localStorage.setItem('tasks', JSON.stringify(tasks)); }`
Both functions operate on an array of task objects `{ id: string, text: string, completed: boolean }`. They will be imported by App.js for persistence.

Implement a functional component `TodoInput` that receives props: `onAdd(text)`, `onEdit(id, newText)`, `editTask` (object or null). The component holds internal state `inputValue`. When `editTask` changes, populate the input with its text. On form submit, if `editTask` exists call `onEdit(editTask.id, inputValue)`, else call `onAdd(inputValue)`. Reset input after submission. Export default `TodoInput`. This component will be used by App.js to add or edit tasks.

Create a functional component `TodoItem` with props: `task` (object), `onToggle(id)`, `onDelete(id)`, `onStartEdit(id)`. Render a `<li>` containing a checkbox bound to `task.completed` that triggers `onToggle(task.id)`, a span showing `task.text` (styled with line‑through when completed), an edit button that calls `onStartEdit(task.id)`, and a delete button that calls `onDelete(task.id)`. Export default `TodoItem`. This component will be used inside `TodoList`.

Implement `TodoList` component that receives props: `tasks` (array), `filter` ('all'|'active'|'completed'), `onToggle(id)`, `onDelete(id)`, `onStartEdit(id)`. Compute `visibleTasks` based on filter. Map over `visibleTasks` rendering `TodoItem` for each, passing down the callbacks. Wrap list in `<ul className='todo-list'>`. Export default `TodoList`. This component will be rendered by App.js.

Create a functional component `FilterBar` with props: `currentFilter`, `onChangeFilter(newFilter)`. Render three buttons or links labeled "All", "Active", "Completed". Highlight the active filter (e.g., with a CSS class). Clicking a button calls `onChangeFilter` with the corresponding filter string. Export default `FilterBar`. App.js will use this to switch view and to clear completed tasks.

Implement the main `App` component: - Import React, useState, useEffect, the utility functions `loadTasks` and `saveTasks`, and all components created earlier. - Define state: `tasks` (array), `filter` (string, default 'all'), `editTask` (object|null). - On mount (`useEffect` with empty deps) load tasks via `loadTasks` and set state. - Whenever `tasks` change, persist them via `saveTasks`. - Define handler functions: * `addTask(text)` creates a new task object `{ id: uuidv4(), text, completed: false }` and appends to `tasks`. * `toggleTask(id)` flips `completed` flag. * `deleteTask(id)` removes task. * `startEditTask(id)` sets `editTask` to the matching task. * `editTaskHandler(id, newText)` updates the task's text and clears `editTask`. * `changeFilter(newFilter)` sets `filter`. * `clearCompleted()` filters out completed tasks. - Render layout: `
` containing `

Todo

`, ``, ``, ``, and a button "Clear Completed" that calls `clearCompleted`. - Export default `App`. This component wires together all previous components and utilities, providing the full feature set.

Write CSS to style the application responsively:
- Global body styling (font, margin, background).
- `.app` container with max‑width, centering, padding.
- Styles for input field, buttons, and list items.
- `.todo-list li` layout with flex, aligning checkbox, text, and action icons.
- `.completed` class (or using `[type='checkbox']:checked + span`) to apply `text-decoration: line-through; opacity: 0.6;`.
- Media query for screens < 600px to stack controls vertically and increase tap targets.
- Highlight active filter button in `FilterBar`.
No JS code, but class names must match those used in components.
This file will be imported in `src/App.js` via `import './App.css';`.

plan.name: SimpleTodoApp
plan.description: A simple web-based To-Do application that allows users to add, edit, complete, delete, and filter tasks. The app runs entirely in the browser and persists data using localStorage, requiring no backend.
features: User can mark tasks as completed/uncompleted
Persist tasks across sessions using localStorage
Responsive UI for desktop and mobile

Utility functions to load and save tasks to browser localStorage
